newsitem.title: ROMANIA: ROMANIA PRESIDENT TO VISIT GERMANY FOR NATO SUPPORT.
newsitem.headline: ROMANIA PRESIDENT TO VISIT GERMANY FOR NATO SUPPORT.

text.p: Romanian President Emil Constantinescu will visit Germany in July, in a last-ditch attempt to boost his country's chances to get an early admission in NATO, a senior official said on Tuesday.

"The president's official visit to Germany on July 2 will have a special significance in the context of Romania's real chances to join NATO in the first group," Prime Minister Victor Ciorbea told a news conference.
Poland, Hungary and the Czech Republic are seen as favorites in a NATO expansion. Slovenia and Romania are trailing behind.
Constantinescu's visit to Bonn is scheduled ahead of the NATO summit in Madrid where the Alliance is expected to announce its new members.

France, Italy, Spain, Portugal, Greece and Turkey have expressed public support for Romania's bid to win early admission. But the United States, Britain and Germany have so far remain cool on the issue.
Romania's centrist coalition government, which ousted the former ruling leftists in elections last November, has made NATO membership its main political goal.
Over the past months, Bucharest sent ambassadors, including Romania's former King Michael, to all 16 NATO member countries in a bid to persuade them consider Romania's NATO candidacy.
"In countries which have not yet decided on whom to back -- mainly the United States and Germany -- the degree of support is on the rise," Ciorbea said on Tuesday.
